Quality is our main aim. We promise beautiful flowers with a long lifespan. During our cultivation process we do everything we can to positively influence such quality. Together with other stakeholders in the market we constantly work on improvement. For example, we contemplate energy transition in our industry, capacity distribution, waste management and horticultural drain water. As an organisation, we are central in our community; we also try to make a contribution to this. This means working together with the supply chain to tailor our available products correctly to customer needs. Just as humans need oxygen, flowers need CO2 to grow. At LinFlowers we are looking for ways to employ used CO2. After all, it is a shame to make CO2 ourselves, while we want to reduce it in the atmosphere. This is why we capture CO2 emissions from our energy source and employ them in […]

Light is an important prerequisite for flowers to grow. This is why we have invested in diffuse glass that spreads the light better. Through conventional glass, light is more bundled which makes growth less even. Diffuse light ensures that stems are of equal length at harvest time. The average growing time for chrysanthemums is 10 weeks. Temperature has an impact on growth. To prevent growth in the summer from being too fast we need to regulate the temperature. Flowers need light to grow properly. As a result, cultivation takes longer in winter than in the summer. Flowers then need more space to get more light per stem. Harmful insects are disastrous to crops. When present in large numbers, the flowers, leaves and roots all suffer damage. Controlling them is therefore essential.
